availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth of Massachusetts
County of Suffolk } S. S.

I, James B. Bell, duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky a Commissioner, for the State of Kentucky, resident at Boston in the State of Massachusetts, do solemnly swear, that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner, under and by virtue of the laws of said State of Kentucky
Sworn and subscribed to before me, this Fifth day of October A. D. 1865

Theo. H. Bell
Justice of the Peace
T. H. B.
Oct 5th
1865

Commonwealth of Massachusetts
County of Suffolk } S. S.

In witness whereof, I have set hereunto my hand, and affixed my official seal, as Commissioner of the said State of Kentucky, at the City of Boston, and County and State aforesaid, on this Fifth day of October A. D. 1865

figure.ab:
JAMES B. Bell
COMMISSIONER
BOSTON, MASS.

body.p:
Jas B. Bell
Commissioner of the State of Kentucky, for the State and County first Mentioned

Comr of Deeds
Massachusetts
Oath of Jas P. Bell
filed 9th Oct 1865
